Course Section: CHIN_V 451-011 - Introductory Modern Chinese Literature I
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Placement Procedure -Prior to registration in any CHIN-titled courses, students are required to complete the Placement Procedure every Winter session or Summer Session and obtain a placement approval certificate for the courses they wish to register for. Students are only eligible for courses listed on their placement approval certificate. Students enrolled in sections which they do not have placement approval for will be removed from the course.

Delivery Mode -This course is offered as a merged course with CHIN441, at the same time in the same room but with separate course syllabi. This course has 3 instructional hrs/wk in person, 1.5 hours on Monday and 1.5 hrs on Wednesday, both conducted synchronously. For further information regarding CHIN courses, please go to https://chinese.arts.ubc.ca/courses/ .

Waitlist Policy -All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

Students are only eligible for courses listed on their placement approval certificate. Students enrolled in sections which they do not have placement approval for will be removed from the course. 

Delivery Mode -This course is fully online with 3 instructional hrs per week, 1.5 hrs on Monday and 1.5 hrs on Wednesday, both conducted synchronously. Students are expected to meet online using Zoom on the days and times listed. All courses labelled as ‘online’ are fully online for the entire term, including exams, and do NOT require any in-person attendance to complete.

Course Section: CNPS_V 426-63A - The Role of the Teacher in Guidance
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Online, asynchronous.

This is a core course for the Diploma in Education - Guidance Studies and the Minor in Education - Interpersonal Development.
This is an elective course for the Certificate in Health & Wellness.

Registration will be blocked when the course is full and seats will be filled from the waitlist.
A priority sequence waitlist is available for this course.

For information on waitlists and restrictions for CNPS courses, including when restrictions will be removed, please visit https://pdce.educ.ubc.ca/online-courses and click on CNPS under the Subject Heading.  

Inquiries: online.educ@ubc.ca

Placement Procedure -Prior to registration in any CNTO-titled courses, students are required to complete the Placement Procedure every Winter Session or Summer Session and obtain a placement approval certificate for the courses they wish to register for. Students are only eligible for courses listed on their placement approval certificate. Students enrolled in sections which they do not have placement approval for will be removed from the course.
Delivery Mode -This is a synchronous online course.  Students are expected to meet online using Zoom on the days and times listed.

Waitlist Policy -All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

Placement Procedure -Prior to registration in any CNTO-titled courses, students are required to complete the Placement Procedure every Winter Session or Summer Session and obtain a placement approval certificate for the courses they wish to register for. Students are only eligible for courses listed on their placement approval certificate. Students enrolled in sections which they do not have placement approval for will be removed from the course.
Delivery Mode -This is a mixed hybrid course. Students are expected to meet in-person on the days and times listed, as well as complete supplemental asynchronous work outside of class time. Please refer to the course syllabus for details on the asynchronous elements of this course. All courses labelled as ‘hybrid’ have a mixture of mandatory in-person and online activities as designed by the instructor. While some components are online, in-person attendance IS required to complete the course. 

Waitlist Policy -All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.
